intro: Rhamnoluma deplanchei, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has a short lifespan, often completing its growth cycle within a single rainy season. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens for its ornamental value.
